result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:02 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Timothy Hogan.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hogan has received a copy of the pre-sentence investigation report and makes statement regarding corrections.  No further additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the pre-sentence investigation report with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing argument by Atty Hogan.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 - 12 years of Initial Confinement and 10 years of Extended Supervision.
Count 5 - 8 years of Initial Confinement and 10 years of Extended Supervision Consecutive to count 1

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-No Contact with minors w/o permission of the agent.  
-AODA & any follow-up
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
-register as sex offender
-Sex Offender Treatment

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the CIP and SAP.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from March 27, 2014 to present. 

Statement by Atty Hogan - requests supervised vistation with QTB and Michael L. B.  Court allows supervised visitation while in prison.

Court adjourned at 11:28 a.m.
to counsel with copy of the Pre-sentence Investigation Report
Sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

3:10 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Timothy Hogan.

ADA recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 and count 5 - DRI the balance of the counts - request a Presentence Investigation Report.  State agrees not to charge an additional charge.  Attorney Hogan concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 and 5.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 5 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court DRI the balance of the counts.

Court orders PSI completed within 60 days - sentencing to be held thereafter.

Court adjourned at 3:19 p.m.
from Circuit Court to DA Christenson dated September 9, 2014 in regards to conditions of bond w/attachments
Inmate request to the court w/attachments
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

3:37 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Timothy Hogan present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Hogan - requests plea hearing be scheduled.

Court directs matter be set for Plea/Sentencing.

Court adjourned at 3:37 p.m.
Status hearing on August 26, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

1:48 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant not present.  Attorney Timothy Hogan present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Hogan - there may be additional charges being filed.  Statement by ADA.  

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Status hearing on June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

4:08 p.m.   State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Timothy Hogan present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Hogan - requests a further adjournment.  Statement by ADA.  Court directs matter be set for Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 4:09 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on May 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's
by Atty Timothy E. Hogan

11:01 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Timothy Hogan.

Statement by Attorney Hogan - defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Hogan.  Attorney Hogan confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to all counts.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties - same as in the complaint.

Court grants defense counsel up to ten days to request a substitution of counsel, if so requested.

Court directs Status Hearing be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 11:04 a.m.
By Atty Timothy Hogan
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

9:02 a.m.  Defendant in custody present in court with Atty Reisha Mitchell.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mitchell confirms receipt of the criminal complaint, states the defendant did not receive a copy, but is reviewing one.  Atty Mitchell & defendant waive reading of the complaint.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court notes bond has been set.  Statement by Atty Mitcehll, the defendant requests a prelim and does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary on Tuesday.

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.

No Contact with the co-defendant Kelley J. B.  No Contact with the victim - JJJK (d.o.b - 01/16/2009) and No Contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is not to use anything that is able to access the internet.  Defendant is not to possess any equipment capable of taking pictures.

3:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court, in custody and via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Patrick Taylor - Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Statement by the Court regarding potential charges.  Spec Pros goves over bond recommendation.  Court orders $150,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with the co-defendant Kelley J. B.  No Contact with the victim - JJJK (d.o.b - 01/16/2009) and No Contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is not to use anything that is able to access the internet.  Defendant is not to possess any equipment capable of taking pictures.  Status to be hld in 2 weeks.
